2954.verse: وَتِلْكَ|And this|74|83|2028$نِعْمَةٌ|(is the) favor|108|126|12899$تَمُنُّهَا|with which you reproach|183|201|12900$عَلَىَّ|[on] me,|77|95|4174$أَنْ|that|48|66|655$عَبَّدتَّ|you have enslaved|144|153|12901$بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٲٓءِيلَ|(the) Children of Israel."|180|180|10567$

2955.verse: قَالَ فِرْعَوْنُ|Firaun said|134|171|12902$وَمَا|"And what|88|161|46$رَبُّ|(is the) Lord|102|175|6232$ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ|(of) the worlds?"|131|168|8$

2956.verse: قَالَ|He said,|73|82|309$رَبُّ|"Lord|59|77|6232$ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٲتِ|(of) the heavens|132|150|351$وَٱلْأَرْضِ|and the earth|111|129|352$وَمَا|and whatever|111|129|46$بَيْنَهُمَآ‌ۖ|(is) between them,|147|156|3978$إِن|if|44|146|225$كُنتُم|you (should) be|124|329|214$مُّوقِنِينَ|convinced."|97|200|12903$

2958.verse: قَالَ|He said,|73|112|309$رَبُّكُمْ|"Your Lord|88|165|3243$وَرَبُّ|and (the) Lord|116|193|12356$ءَابَآئِكُمُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ|(of) your forefathers."|167|206|12905$

2961.verse: قَالَ|He said,|73|82|309$لَئِنِ|"If|52|70|6615$ٱتَّخَذْتَ|you take|86|104|12907$إِلَـٰهًا|a god|61|79|1222$غَيْرِى|other than me,|119|137|12908$لَأَجْعَلَنَّكَ|I will surely make you|162|180|12909$مِنَ|among|63|72|156$ٱلْمَسْجُونِينَ|those imprisoned."|141|141|12910$

2965.verse: وَنَزَعَ|And he drew out|130|138|6662$يَدَهُۥ|his hand|75|91|6663$فَإِذَا|and behold!|97|113|1730$هِىَ|It|53|69|665$بَيْضَآءُ|(was) white|99|115|6664$لِلنَّـٰظِرِينَ|for the observers.|139|147|6665$

2966.verse: قَالَ|He said|68|84|309$لِلْمَلَإِ|to the chiefs|105|137|12912$حَوْلَهُۥٓ|around him,|97|129|10210$إِنَّ|"Indeed,|75|107|58$هَـٰذَا|this|59|91|248$لَسَـٰحِرٌ|(is) surely a magician|161|177|6666$عَلِيمٌ|learned.|73|73|307$

2968.verse: قَالُوٓاْ|They said,|89|106|101$أَرْجِهْ|"Post pone him|118|152|6670$وَأَخَاهُ|and his brother,|125|159|6671$وَٱبْعَثْ|and send|85|119|1179$فِى|in|48|82|89$ٱلْمَدَآئِنِ|the cities|90|107|6673$حَـٰشِرِينَ|gatherers -|102|102|6674$

2970.verse: فَجُمِعَ|So were assembled|147|155|12915$ٱلسَّحَرَةُ|the magicians|111|127|6702$لِمِيقَـٰتِ|for (the) appointment|164|180|12916$يَوْمٍ|(on) a day|90|106|2331$مَّعْلُومٍ|well-known.|99|107|9742$

2952.verse: [Moses] said, "I did it, then, while I was of those astray.

2953.verse: So I fled from you when I feared you. Then my Lord granted me wisdom and prophethood and appointed me [as one] of the messengers.

2954.verse: And is this a favor of which you remind me - that you have enslaved the Children of Israel?"

2955.verse: Said Pharaoh, "And what is the Lord of the worlds?"

2956.verse: [Moses] said, "The Lord of the heavens and earth and that between them, if you should be convinced."

2957.verse: [Pharaoh] said to those around him, "Do you not hear?"

2958.verse: [Moses] said, "Your Lord and the Lord of your first forefathers."

2959.verse: [Pharaoh] said, "Indeed, your 'messenger' who has been sent to you is mad."

2960.verse: [Moses] said, "Lord of the east and the west and that between them, if you were to reason."

2961.verse: [Pharaoh] said, "If you take a god other than me, I will surely place you among those imprisoned."

2962.verse: [Moses] said, "Even if I brought you proof manifest?"

2963.verse: [Pharaoh] said, "Then bring it, if you should be of the truthful."

2964.verse: So [Moses] threw his staff, and suddenly it was a serpent manifest.

2965.verse: And he drew out his hand; thereupon it was white for the observers.

2966.verse: [Pharaoh] said to the eminent ones around him, "Indeed, this is a learned magician.

2967.verse: He wants to drive you out of your land by his magic, so what do you advise?"

2968.verse: They said, "Postpone [the matter of] him and his brother and send among the cities gatherers

2969.verse: Who will bring you every learned, skilled magician."

2970.verse: So the magicians were assembled for the appointment of a well-known day.

2971.verse: And it was said to the people, "Will you congregate
